stall.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a table or a small shop with an open front, especially outdoors, where goods are sold
stall.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: an enclosed area in a building for an animal such as a horse or cow
stall.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if a plane goes into a stall, its engine stops working
stall.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a seat in a row of fixed seats for priests and singers in some larger churches
stall.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: if an engine or vehicle stalls, or if you stall it, it stops because there is not enough power or speed to keep it going
stall.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: An inexperienced pilot may easily stall a plane.
stall.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to deliberately delay because you are not ready to do something, answer questions etc
stall.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Quit stalling and answer my question!
He was just stalling for time.
stall.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to make someone wait or stop something from happening until you are ready
stall.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Maybe we can stall the sale until the prices go up.
Weâ€™ve got to stall him somehow.
stall.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to stop making progress or developing
stall.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: While his career has stalled, hers has taken off.
stall.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a table on which goods are placed, found in a public place such as a market
stall.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to stop or cause something to stop, usually before continuing again
stall.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Investment in the country has stalled and billions of dollars have been transferred elsewhere.
Maybe we can stall the sale until the prices go up.
When the previous contract expired and bargainingtalks stalled, the workers went on strike.
stall.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: to be delayed, or to delay something or someone
stall.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: Sales of cars fell 12.7% in mid-April, further stalling a hoped-for recovery for the industry.
